title: CVPR_2009_18_abs

sentences.text: We present a new method for detecting interest points using histogram information .

Unlike existing interest point detectors , which measure pixel-wise differences in image intensity , our detectors incorporate histogram-based representations , and thus can find image regions that present a distinct distribution in the neighborhood .
The proposed detectors are able to capture large-scale structures and distinctive textured patterns , and exhibit strong invariance to rotation , illumination variation , and blur .

The experimental results show that the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors perform particularly well for the tasks of matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes , in terms of repeatability and distinctiveness .
An extension of our method to space-time interest point detection for action classification is also presented .

Entity-our_detector.description: Our detectors refer to a novel type of interest point detectors that utilize histogram-based representations to identify image regions with distinct distributions, enhancing their ability to capture large-scale structures and textured patterns while maintaining invariance to rotation, illumination changes, and blur.

Entity-distinctive_textured_pattern.description: Distinctive textured patterns refer to unique surface characteristics in images that can be effectively identified and analyzed by the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors, which are designed to recognize variations in texture and structure while maintaining robustness against changes in rotation, illumination, and blur.

Entity-interest_point.label: interest points
Entity-interest_point.description: Interest points refer to specific locations in an image that are identified using histogram-based methods to capture distinct distributions in the neighborhood, enabling robust detection of large-scale structures and textured patterns.

Entity-textured_scene.label: textured scenes
Entity-textured_scene.description: Textured scenes refer to image regions characterized by distinct patterns and structures that can be effectively matched and analyzed using histogram-based interest point detection methods, particularly under varying conditions such as blur and illumination changes.

Entity-textured_pattern.label: textured patterns
Entity-textured_pattern.description: Textured patterns refer to distinctive visual features in images that exhibit unique distributions in their pixel intensity or color, which can be effectively captured by the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors for robust image analysis.

Entity-repeatability_and_distinctiveness.label: repeatability and distinctiveness
Entity-repeatability_and_distinctiveness.description: Repeatability and distinctiveness refer to the effectiveness of the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors in consistently identifying and distinguishing textured regions in images, particularly under varying conditions such as blur and illumination changes.

Entity-interest_point_detector.label: interest point detectors
Entity-interest_point_detector.description: Interest point detectors are algorithms or tools used in image processing to identify and locate significant points in an image that can be used for further analysis or feature extraction.

Entity-matching_textured_scene.label: matching textured scenes
Entity-matching_textured_scene.description: Matching textured scenes refers to the task of identifying and aligning image regions with similar texture patterns, particularly under varying conditions such as blur and changes in illumination, using histogram-based interest point detection methods.

Entity-distinctiveness.label: distinctiveness
Entity-distinctiveness.description: Distinctiveness refers to a performance metric used to evaluate the effectiveness of histogram-based interest point detectors in identifying and matching textured scenes, particularly under varying conditions such as blur and illumination changes.

Entity-distribution.label: distribution
Entity-distribution.description: In this context, 'distribution' refers to the statistical representation of pixel intensity values in image regions, which is utilized by the proposed interest point detectors to identify areas with distinct characteristics based on histogram information.

Entity-an_extension_of_our_method.label: An extension of our method
Entity-an_extension_of_our_method.description: An extension of our method refers to the adaptation of the proposed histogram-based interest point detection technique for the specific application of space-time interest point detection aimed at action classification.

Entity-strong_invariance_to_rotation.label: strong invariance to rotation
Entity-strong_invariance_to_rotation.description: Strong invariance to rotation refers to the property of the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors that allows them to consistently identify and match image features regardless of the orientation of the image, thereby enhancing their robustness against changes in viewpoint.

Entity-large-scale_structure.label: large-scale structures
Entity-large-scale_structure.description: Large-scale structures refer to significant patterns or formations in images that can be effectively detected by the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors, which are designed to identify distinct distributions in image regions.

Entity-distinct_distribution_in_the_neig.label: distinct distribution in the neighborhood
Entity-distinct_distribution_in_the_neig.description: The term 'distinct distribution in the neighborhood' refers to the unique arrangement of pixel intensity values within a localized area of an image, as identified by histogram-based representations in the context of interest point detection.

Entity-space-time_interest_point_detecti.label: space-time interest point detection
Entity-space-time_interest_point_detecti.description: Space-time interest point detection is a technique used in computer vision to identify significant points in a video that capture important spatial and temporal information, facilitating tasks such as action classification.

Entity-histogram-based_representation.label: histogram-based representations
Entity-histogram-based_representation.description: Histogram-based representations are data structures that summarize the distribution of pixel intensities or features in an image by dividing the intensity range into bins and counting the number of pixels that fall into each bin.

Entity-rotation.label: rotation
Entity-rotation.description: In this context, 'rotation' refers to the property of the proposed interest point detectors that allows them to maintain consistent performance despite changes in the orientation of the image, thereby demonstrating robustness against geometric transformations.

Entity-pixel-wise_difference_in_image_in.label: pixel-wise differences in image intensity
Entity-pixel-wise_difference_in_image_in.description: Pixel-wise differences in image intensity refer to the measurement of variations in brightness values at individual pixels in an image, which is commonly used in image processing to identify changes or features within the image.

Entity-illumination_change.label: illumination changes
Entity-illumination_change.description: Illumination changes refer to variations in lighting conditions that affect the appearance of images, impacting the performance of interest point detectors in computer vision tasks.

Entity-histogram_information.label: histogram information
Entity-histogram_information.description: Histogram information refers to data that represents the distribution of values in a dataset, typically visualized as a histogram, which summarizes the frequency of different ranges of values.

Entity-neighborhood.label: neighborhood
Entity-neighborhood.description: In this context, 'neighborhood' refers to the local spatial area around a given point in an image where distinct histogram-based distributions are analyzed to detect interest points.

Entity-image_intensity.label: image intensity
Entity-image_intensity.description: Image intensity refers to the brightness or darkness of a pixel in an image, representing the amount of light captured at that point.

Entity-illumination_variation.label: illumination variation
Entity-illumination_variation.description: Illumination variation refers to the changes in light conditions that affect the appearance of objects in images, impacting how they are perceived and processed in image analysis.

Entity-image_region.label: image regions
Entity-image_region.description: Image regions refer to specific areas or segments within an image that can be analyzed or processed, often characterized by distinct visual features or properties.

Entity-blur.label: blur
Entity-blur.description: In the context of image processing, 'blur' refers to a visual effect that results in a loss of sharpness and detail in images, often caused by factors such as motion or defocus, which can significantly impact the quality and distinctiveness of image features.

Entity-action_classification.label: action classification
Entity-action_classification.description: Action classification is a machine learning task that involves identifying and categorizing actions or activities from visual data, typically in the context of computer vision.

Entity-repeatability.label: repeatability
Entity-repeatability.description: Repeatability refers to the ability of a measurement or experimental result to be consistently reproduced under the same conditions, often used as an evaluation criterion or performance metric in various scientific and engineering contexts.

Entity-experimental_result.label: experimental results
Entity-experimental_result.description: Experimental results refer to the data and findings obtained from conducting experiments, which are used to evaluate the performance or effectiveness of a hypothesis, method, or system.

summary: We present a new method for detecting interest points using histogram information . Unlike existing interest point detectors , which measure pixel-wise differences in image intensity , our detectors incorporate histogram-based representations , and thus can find image regions that present a distinct distribution in the neighborhood . The proposed detectors are able to capture large-scale structures and distinctive textured patterns , and exhibit strong invariance to rotation , illumination variation , and blur . The experimental results show that the proposed histogram-based interest point detectors perform particularly well for the tasks of matching textured scenes under blur and illumination changes , in terms of repeatability and distinctiveness . An extension of our method to space-time interest point detection for action classification is also presented .

Predicate-detects.label: detects
Predicate-detects.description: The predicate 'detects' indicates an action or process by which the subject identifies, recognizes, or discerns the presence of the object. In this context, the subject is typically an entity or system capable of observation or analysis, while the object represents the specific elements or features being identified. The relationship established by 'detects' implies a capability of the subject to perceive or measure the object, often involving the use of techniques, tools, or algorithms.

Predicate-uses.label: uses

It signifies that the subject actively engages with the object in a way that facilitates a process, action, or application.

In this context, it implies that the subject is performing an evaluation or calculation to determine the extent, amount, or degree of the object, which represents a measurable attribute or phenomenon.

Predicate-incorporate.label: incorporate

It connects the subject to the object by asserting that the object is a defining or notable aspect that can be observed or identified within the context of the subject.

Predicate-find.label: find

It connects the subject, which performs the action, to the object, which is the entity being discovered or identified. It implies that the subject possesses the necessary attributes, tools, or mechanisms to effectively engage with and obtain information about the object, which in this context refers to a specific type of entity or phenomenon.

Predicate-exhibit.label: exhibit

It implies a relationship where the subject actively reveals or makes evident the nature of the object in a way that can be observed or measured.

Predicate-capture.label: capture
Predicate-capture.description: The predicate 'capture' denotes the action of seizing, recording, or obtaining information or entities by the subject, which results in the subject acquiring or representing the object. In this context, it implies that the subject is actively engaging in a process that allows it to grasp or document the characteristics or existence of the object.

Predicate-show.label: show
Predicate-show.description: The predicate 'show' indicates a relationship where the subject provides evidence, demonstration, or illustration of the object. Predicate-is_presented_for.label: is presented for

Predicate-utilize.label: utilize
Predicate-utilize.description: The predicate 'utilize' indicates that the subject is actively employing or making use of the object in a practical or effective manner. It suggests a purposeful application of the object to achieve a specific function or outcome.

Predicate-utilizes.description: The predicate 'utilizes' indicates that the subject employs or makes use of the object in order to achieve a specific purpose or function. It conveys a relationship where the subject actively incorporates the object as a tool, resource, or method to enhance its effectiveness or to accomplish a task.

Predicate-is_a_method_for.label: is a method for

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or concept that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the subject is a subset or a specialized form of the broader term, allowing for classification and organization of knowledge within a particular domain.
